title: Issue running Unity environment in headless AWS machine
body:
Hi,
I am trying to run the Unity environment executable in a Linux environment on a remote headless AWS machine. 
I downloaded the executable from: http://virtual-home.org/release/simulator/last_release/linux_exec.zip
I then setup and run the X server.

Following the instructions in the Readme, I am able to execute the executable as : DISPLAY=:display_num ./{path_sim}/{exec_file}.x86_64 -batchmode

Now I want to use this inside a python script and try the other method including:
from simulation.unity_simulator import comm_unity
comm = comm_unity.UnityCommunication(file_name=file_name, port={your_port}, x_display={your_display})

However, this doesnt run for me.
This is the log it generates:
>>> from unity_simulator import comm_unity
>>> comm = comm_unity.UnityCommunication(file_name='/home/ubuntu/MARL/hctc/linux_exec.v2.2.4.x86_64', port='8000', x_display=0)
['/home/ubuntu/MARL/hctc/linux_exec.v2.2.4.x86_64', '-batchmode', '-http-port=8000', '-logFile /home/ubuntu/MARL/virtualhome/simulation/unity_simulator/Player_8000.log']
/home/ubuntu/MARL/hctc/linux_exec.v2.2.4.x86_64: error while loading shared libraries: UnityPlayer.so: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
Getting connection...
CLOSING PROC

It keeps waiting on Getting connection and then times out and dies. I do see a UnityPlayer.so cant be opened error, but it is present in the same folder from where I am running this so not sure why that error comes.

Any ideas?
